meanings.definition: A category that is a subset of a larger category.
meanings.sent1: In the library, the mystery books are a subclass of the fiction category.
meanings.sent2: The dessert section is a subclass of the menu at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The subclass of cupcakes in the bakery made the cookies jealous.
meanings.sent4: The tiny island was like a subclass of the vast ocean, isolated yet connected.
meanings.sent5: The subclass of puppies in the litter was the most playful and energetic.

meanings.definition: To classify or categorize as a subset of a larger category.
meanings.sent1: The teacher will subclass the students based on their reading levels.
meanings.sent2: She decided to subclass her wardrobe by color to make it easier to find clothes.
meanings.sent3: He tried to subclass his friends into groups based on their favorite sports.
meanings.sent4: The artist would subclass the paintings according to their themes and colors.
meanings.sent5: The chef would subclass the ingredients to ensure a balanced flavor in the dish.
